alert.note: Alert for Fremont County Including Canon City, Howard, Texas Creek; Huerfano County Including Walsenburg; Northern El Paso County Including Monument and Black Forest; San Luis Valley Including Alamosa, Del Norte, Fort Garland, Saguache; Southern Front Range Including Sangre De Cristo Mountains, Wet Mountains, La Veta Pass; Teller County, Rampart Range Including Pikes Peak and Florissant Fossil Beds National Monument (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Red Flag Warning issued April 11 at 3:40PM MDT until April 12 at 8:00PM MDT by NWS Pueblo
info.description: ...Red Flag Warning in effect through 8 PM MDT Today for gusty winds and low humidity values for fire weather zones 221, 224, 225, and zones 226 through 237, which includes all of the eastern plains of southeast Colorado, Teller county, Fremont county, the southeast mountains, and the San Luis valley... ...Red Flag Warning remains in effect from 11 AM TO 8 PM Tuesday for gusty winds and low humidity values for fire weather zones 221, 224, 225, and zones 226 through 237, which includes all of the eastern plains of southeast Colorado, Teller county, Fremont county, the southeast mountains, and the San Luis valley... ...RED FLAG WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 8 PM MDT THIS EVENING FOR FIRE WEATHER ZONES 221...222... 224...225...226 AND 229... ...RED FLAG WARNING IN EFFECT FROM 11 AM TO 8 PM MDT TUESDAY FOR FIRE WEATHER ZONES 221...222...224... 225...226 AND 229... The National Weather Service in Pueblo has issued a Red Flag Warning for very strong winds and low relative humidity, which is in effect from 11 AM to 8 PM MDT Tuesday. * Affected Area...Fire Weather Zones 221...222...224...225... 226 and 229. * Winds...For Today, southwest 25 to 35 mph with gusts up to 40 to 50 mph. For Tuesday, southwest 40 to 50 mph with gusts up to 90 mph. * Timing...Through 8 PM MDT today. 11 AM TO 8 PM MDT Tuesday. * Relative Humidity...As low as 12 percent. * Impacts...Conditions will be favorable for rapid rates of fire growth and spread.
info.instruction: A Red Flag Warning means that critical fire weather conditions are either occurring now, or will shortly. A combination of strong winds, low relative humidity, and warm temperatures can contribute to extreme fire behavior.
